title: Johan Devrindt
text:
Johannes "Johan" Devrindt (born 14 April 1945) is a retired <a href="Belgium">Belgian</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player.
Club career.
He played for <a href="R.S.C.%20Anderlecht">Anderlecht</a>, Dutch outfit <a href="PSV%20Eindhoven">PSV Eindhoven</a>, <a href="Club%20Brugge%20K.V.">Club Brugge</a>, <a href="K.S.C.%20Lokeren%20Oost-Vlaanderen">Lokeren</a>, <a href="K.R.C.%20Genk">Winterslag</a> and <a href="R.A.A.%20Louvi%C3%A9roise">La Louviere</a> before hanging up his boots after suffering relegation with second division <a href="K.V.K.%20Tienen">Tienen</a>.
International career.
Devrindt made his debut for <a href="Belgium%20national%20football%20team">Belgium</a> in a September 1964 <a href="friendly%20match">friendly match</a> against <a href="Netherlands%20national%20football%20team">Holland</a> with 10 fellows from the Anderlecht team after the substitution of goalkeeper Delhasse by <a href="Jean-Marie%20Trappeniers">Jean-Marie Trappeniers</a> and has earned a total of 23 caps, scoring 15 goals. He has represented his country in 5 <a href="FIFA%20World%20Cup%20qualification">FIFA World Cup qualification</a> matches and at the <a href="1970%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1970 FIFA World Cup</a>.
His final international was a September 1975 <a href="UEFA%20Euro%201976%20qualifying">UEFA Euro 1976 qualifying</a> match against <a href="East%20Germany%20national%20football%20team">East Germany</a>.
Honours.
Club.
RSC Anderlecht
